events.name: Google Cloud Blockchain ft. Digital Asset, Consensys, Dispatch Labs, Y-center

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
This September 21st Google Developer Groups Cloud (GDG) Fremont & Silicon Valley are teaming up to bring you an exciting blockchain panel, with four companies prominent in the ecosystem.

Google has officially announced its partnerships with Digital Asset working with distributed ledger technology (DLT) in its efforts to bring the technology to its cloud platform.

1. Digital Asset (digitalasset.com) is bringing its blockchain solutions and developer tools to Google Cloud through this partnership. The partnership with Google Cloud will provide developers with a full stack solution, enabling them to unlock the potential for web-paced innovation in blockchain.

2. Dispatch (dispatchlabs.io) is creating a new DLT platform for Dapp developers. A platform that’s truly scalable, insanely fast, and completely free of transaction fees.

3. ConsenSys (new.consensys.net) is a blockchain software technology company founded by Joseph Lubin based in Brooklyn, New York. It is a global formation of technologists and entrepreneurs building the infrastructure, applications, and practices that enable a decentralized world.

4. Y-Center (www.y-center.org) is company focused on re-designing education systems to solve real world problems. They offer online/offline courses in Entrepreneurship, Design Thinking and Social Innovation in USA, India and Kenya. Global experiential education. They are passionate about using Blockchain Technology for Social Impact and are eager to share their knowledge with the rest of you.

Additional Info:

FOOD AND DRINKS WILL BE PROVIDED :)

GDG Cloud Silicon Valley will also be talking about a series of developer workshops, challenges, and events in the upcoming months. Following this first kick-off panel and mixer, we are eager to make this meetup catered for the developers and have as many hands-on/interactive experiences we can for you all. We also want to hear your ideas on what types of meetups you would be interested in. So with that being said, lets build the biggest GDG Cloud Community in the Valley and more importantly a family.

events.name: Machine Learning Workshop ft. Kaggle Competition/CodeLabs

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Join GDG Cloud Silicon Valley for a hands-on workshop where you will solve machine learning problems from beginning-to-end using Logistic Regression.

Logistic regression is a statistical method for analyzing a dataset in which there are one or more independent variables that determine an outcome.

The outcome is measured with a dichotomous variable (in which there are only two possible outcomes). We would use Logistic Regression algorithms to determine if passengers on Titanic survived or died based on their attributes.

In this workshop you can expect to:

1) Get a quick overview of Machine Learning.
2) Get an environment set on your laptop to learn machine learning.
3) Walkthrough "Titanic" example from beginning to end.

• What to bring
Laptop with wifi capability and Chrome installed

events.name: Introduction to Blockchain opportunities - Hackathons, and Prizes

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
We are going to introduce you to various opportunities in Blockchain world, talk about some immediate opportunities to participate in and onboard developers, entrepreneurs. We will talk about some upcoming events and hackathons where there are millions of dollars of prizes are at stake.

You will meet representative/delegates from a $5 Billion market cap public blockchain project.

We are also doing some raffles for free tickets to upcoming events in the area.

events.name: [FREE] 2 Day Bootcamp - Python for Data Science

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Join us!

This coming October 27 & 28th, we welcome to join our upcoming cohort for a hands-on developer bootcamp where you will solve machine learning problems from beginning-to-end using Logistic Regression. This is a FREE 12-hour bootcamp [9:00 am - 4:00 pm] spread over two days.

Professional trainers will teach you how to use python effectively. This workshop explores Python's place in the scientific ecosystem, and how the language, with several readily available open-source libraries, can serve as a powerful tool for data analysis.

Why Python for Data Science is Important?

Python is a general-purpose programming language that is becoming more and more popular for doing data science. It is often the choice for developers who need to apply statistical techniques or data analysis in their work, or for data scientists whose tasks need to be integrated with web apps or production environments. In particular, Python really shines in the field of machine learning. Its combination of machine learning libraries and flexibility makes Python uniquely well-suited to developing sophisticated models and prediction engines that plug directly into production systems.

One of Python’s greatest assets is its extensive set of libraries. Libraries are sets of routines and functions that are written in a given language. A robust set of libraries can make it easier for developers to perform complex tasks without rewriting many lines of code.

What’s the Job Market for Data Scientists Like?

With millions of worldwide job openings in Big Data, the role of a data scientist has become the hottest job of the decade. In today’s data-based world, companies are using the insights that data scientists provide to stay one step ahead of their competition while keeping overhead costs low. Big names like Oracle, Apple, Microsoft, Booz Allen Hamilton, State Farm, Walmart, and more all regularly have job postings for data scientists.

According to Forbes, for most of 2016, there were an average of 2,900 unique job postings for data scientists each month. According to a McKinsey Global Institute study, it’s predicted that by 2018, there will be almost 200,000 open positions.

What are the Topics Covered?

Basics: Variables and Elementary Types, Operations, Console and Functions

Data Structures: Tuples, Lists, Sets, Dictionaries/Maps

Control flow statements: if, for, break, continue and else statements, while loops

File handling: File I/O and context managers

Exception handling: try, except and finally statements, handling and raising exceptions.

Who Can Attend?

If you have a desire to learn new things, have a programming background/

Who's Teaching?

For the last 25 years, Venkatesh has been working in various domains and various technologies with DATA as a common theme. Starting with Data Warehouses, proceeding on to Data Mining, Business Intelligence and now Machine Learning, Deep Learning & AI.

He successfully co-founded and exited a couple of startups so far. One of which is of Business Intelligence for Enterprises and the other is an Insurance sector product. Currently, he is invested in a few startups in the ML area and also sits on the boards of a few more.

Venkatesh has a Masters in Computers Science and an MBA. He brings his formal education and experience, combined with his passion for DATA to develop Predictive Analytics capabilities to his enterprise clients in pharmaceutical and insurance verticals.

Venkatesh in his spare time also follows his passion for teaching by conducting workshops in Machine Learning where he coaches aspiring students in the joy of DATA.

events.name: Master The Craft Developer Series - IOT in Blockchain with Google Cloud

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Blockchain Craftsmanship in collaboration with The Blockchain University x BUMO x Google Developer Group Cloud Silicon Valley presents Master The Craft: Developer Series.

This is our first episode which features IOT leveraging google cloud and blockchain. In this developer lab you will be able to experience a hands-on lab where we dive deeply into the following:

1. Pull data from a IOT (Rasberry Pi)

2. Track & Process the data through the public cloud (Google Cloud)

3. Execute Smart Contract through Blockchain (BUMO)

By doing so this will allow us to understand the benefits of Web 3.0 technology and the benefits of learning how to apply IOT in your professional career.

This lab is will be an interactive lesson on how payment settlement works with blockchain technology for supply chain use case. The coding language of choice will be JavaScript(Node.JS). Please be prepared to do coding as we will be engaging 5 teams to work independently while also providing on-site/virtual mentors.

The selected Blockchain we will be using is BUMO:

BUMO is a next-generation commercial-grade public Blockchain for ubiquitous and trusted value transfer, which is aimed to build a decentralized application ecosystem featured with extensive digital trust, free-flowing value and public-sharing apps.

events.name: Holiday Party & Social Mixer

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Please join us for our 2018 GDG Cloud Silicon Valley Holiday Party! This is a chance to connect with the other members of the our community and enjoy some holiday festivities.

Please come with ideas and topics you'd like to see us address in 2019 and with ideas on how we can improve.

We will also be announcing some upcoming ML & Blockchain Dev Fests, Workshop Series, & more!

Food and drink will be provided, including adult drinks for our over 21 members.

Looking forward to seeing you all!

events.name: DevFest 2018

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
GDG DevFest 2018 is our annual all-day developer conference that offers speaker sessions across multiple product areas, codelabs, hackathon and more!

Please sign up here

https://www.mlacademy.io/schedule/

IMPORTANT NOTE ***
The room we have can only fill 120 people, and we already have around 200 people who have said they will be attending via various meetup communities. It is a first come first serve basis, so please show up early! If you're unable to get into this bootcamp, we have the same workshop happening the following weekend on the January 19th & 20th.

This coming January 12th & 13th, we welcome to join our upcoming cohort for a hands-on developer bootcamp where you will solve machine learning problems from beginning-to-end using Logistic Regression.

This workshop explores Python's place in the scientific ecosystem, and how the language, with several readily available open-source libraries, can serve as a powerful tool for data analysis.

events.name: GDG Cloud Fremont Dev Fest 2018 [Blockchain Academic Track] CROSSPOST**

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
In this workshop we will introduce developers to blockchain technology space and opportunities to get started. We will discuss how to develop decentralized application, what tools you would need and also introduce you to smart contracts development. Smart contracts are self-executed digital contracts that form the building block of decentralized applications.

Agenda:

1. Introduction to Blockchain opportunities:
- Blockstart incubator (Raman Bindlish)
- Blockchain: The Epicenter (Ana Anbuselvan)
2. Smart contract development on EOSIO (America and Penelope Lopez)
3. Legal and Compliance/Regulations (Rob Crea)
4. Running EOSIO node and a network on Google Cloud (David Watson)
5. Improving user adoption for Blockchain applications (Mark Binder and Tray Lewin)

*Breakfast and lunch will be provided during the workshop

Speakers:

Raman Bindlish is a seasoned technology professional with engineering and marketing background and decades of management experience in Fortune 500 companies. He is a mentor for VC funds and an angel investor. Being a blockchain technology enthusiast, he has been actively participating in public blockchain communities and he is one of the key thought leaders in EOSIO space.

Ana Anbuselvan is an Industry veteran with more than three decades of industry experience in Enterprise and Consumer applications, working in Fortune 500 companies and building companies & ventures. She is currently holding key positions at various companies incl. Founder & Chairman of Industry 4.0 Foundation, Founder, Executive Chairman & CEO of IDMCloud, Inc. (acquired by Oracle in 2016), Co-Founder & CTO of Lock & Key Technology Group, Chief Innovation Officer & Board of Director of GoFindXR.com and has 12+ Ventures in the Industry 4.0 space, Mentor at OneTraction.vc, and Mentor at TiEYoungEnterpreneurs.

America and Penelope Lopez, a.k.a the CyberCode Twins, competed from Beijing to Barcelona and received awards in tech competitions and hackathons, including the NASA International SpaceApps Challenge, AT&T Developer Summit, NEM Global Challenge, IBM Global Innovators Challenge, Intel’s US-China Maker Competition, and Money2020. They’ve showcased VR demos at the White House, and were recently selected among 25 nation-wide scholars by MIT Digital Currency Initiative to attend an intensive program on cryptocurrencies and blockchain at the MIT Media Lab. They are community-involved leaders, currently part of the Intel Software Innovators Program, and active members of shEOS, the first female-founded EOS block producer.

Marc Blinder is the co-founder and Chief Product Officer for AIKON. AIKON makes it easier for developers to build blockchain apps and for people to use them. Blinder ran his first company at 28 years old, a social network called Mobileplay (which he sold to Good Technology) and became Creative Director at Context Optional which sold to Efficient Frontier for $50M. At Efficient Frontier, Marc set up the social business across EMEA before the company was acquired by Adobe for $400M.

Tray Lewin is a software developer, architect, and entrepreneur. He’s founded and led companies, served as a CTO for several successful startups and ran large, distributed, development teams as chief architect and product lead for a large consulting group. He’s also filled the role of global technology strategist for Microsoft, the world’s largest retailer, and a renown investment bank on Wall Street. Since moving to Silicon Valley, Tray has been the CTO and co-founder for several startups including one that won the Launch Festival grand prize and another in the Healthcare space.

Robert M. Crea counsels investment advisers, private funds and broker-dealers on a variety of fund formation, regulatory and compliance, and securities law matters. He regularly works with clients to structure and document U.S. and offshore private investment funds and assists clients with a variety of state and federal regulatory and compliance issues.

events.name: Docker, Kubernetes, & Google Cloud

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
For this Docker and Kubernetes meetup we will be teaching developers how to integrate their already existing applications in the Cloud and showing them how to set cluster states, manage and deploy k8s (Clusters and setup application load balancing with NGINX and Caddy server

Step 1: Dockerize existing applications

Step 2: Deploy your application to Gcloud with GKE

Step3: configure your k8s

Step 4: setup Caddy server and Nginx

events.name: How ML enables Trusted customer Experience. Deep dive into Cloud security.

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Discussion one: How ML enable Trusted customer Experience.

Speaker: Nitin Singhal
Profile: Nitin built the Global Data Engineering Team at PayPal launching multiple Marketing and Risk analytics solutions. Nitin’s team built the Enterprise Data warehouse for PayPal using Teradata and open source tech stack.

Nitin headed Merchant Data Product and launched the first set of developer APIs driving merchant insights for Issuer, acquirer and Merchants. Data Insights were built on Machine learning and data science-driven insights to enable fraud and chargeback mitigation solutions, these solutions were scanning and profiling 600M transactions every single data across 150M merchant records. Nitin’s team launched and supervised and unsupervised model to create a Merchant Knowledgebase.

Nitin had a stint at JPMC building cloud-based third-party Data hub and launched a machine learning data science layer to drive contextual insights for JPMC commercial clients.

Most recently, Nitin is heading Data Management organization at Twitter where his charter is to use Data science and Data Management process framework to safeguard Twitter’s data to drive trust for public expression.

Nitin is passionate about the power of data and loves to speak about Data stories

Topic two: Detail presentation on AWS cloud Security and Google Cloud Security. Learn about the criteria of requirements and elements of Cloud Security. Learn how to prepare an Assessment questionnaire.
You will walk away with over one hundred predefined Assessment questionnaire and the methodology to customize them and prepare more for your business needs.

Speaker: Amit Sarkar

Amit has extremely versatile engineering talents. He has over 20 years of experience in Aerospace engineering, Cloud architecture, DevOps, Program management, Product development, Project management & Software development. He has successfully set up a globally distributed diverse team from scratch.

events.name: Introduction to Machine Learning & Logistic Regression Workshop| Women Who Code

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Agenda:

- Introduction to Machine Learning
- Exploratory Data Analysis (Feature selection mainly)
- Predictive Modeling (A quick introduction to Supervised an Unsupervised models)
- Introduction to Logistic regression
- Logistic Regression model building using an example use case from Kaggle

Pre-requisites:
1. Python 3 installed
2. Anaconda installed and Jupyter notebook running
3. Download the data (The data file is known as data.csv)
https://www.kaggle.com/leemun1/predicting-breast-cancer-logistic-regression/notebook
4. Download all the dependent python libraries in your system(Pandas, Numpy, Seaborn, Matplotlib, Scikit-learn, Statsmodels)

P.S: Some experience with programming will help. It's not a must though.

The above content, in order to cover elaborately might take 4-5 hours but we are going to try our best to cover it in 2/2.5 hours by not deep diving into the statistics part of most of the topics and getting into the hands-on bits right away.

If people are interested we will set up another workshop so we can go deeper.

events.name: I/O Extended 2019 [GDG Fremont/Cloud Silicon Valley/Cloud Fremont]

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Haven't gotten the chance to catch up on what went down at Google I/O?

Welcome to I/O Extended 2019 with GDG Fremont/Cloud Silicon Valley/Cloud Fremont!

We're hosting a viewing party of the 2019 Developer keynote from Google I/O so you can get all caught up as well as some live talks and codelabs.

Agenda:
10:00am: Check-in, Network over coffee.
10:20am: Google I/O Extended 2019 kickoff
11:00am: Live Talk with Vikram Tiwari
11:00am: Live Talk with Michael Solati
12:00pm: Lunch break
12:15pm: Continue lunch break. Who’s looking and who’s hiring?
Looking? Bring your best minute pitch for everyone to hear.
1:00pm: Codelab with Riya - bring your laptops!
1:45pm: Event wrap-up before social hour. Feel free to stick around to chat amongst your fellow devs for a bit or get help on your code! Stay for our goodies raffle. You won't wanna miss out.

ML Study Jam Track
11:00 - 11:20 Intro to Qwiklabs
11:20 - 12:00 GCP Essentials
1:00 - 1:20 Intro to Tensorflow
1:20 - 2:00 Baseline: Data, ML, AI

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------
Speakers:
Michael Solati: Building (Progressive) Web Apps @MichaelSolati

Most people think if they want to build an app they must build two apps for Android or iOS. The web has become so much more powerful in what we can do, though. JavaScript frameworks allow developers to build a powerful web app with a fraction of the time and resources of native apps. While tools like Ionic are allowing developers to make beautiful web apps that look and behave so much like native application with their UI and offline capabilities; so much so that users might not even tell the difference. Even cooler is now you can install apps from the web onto your phone like a native app.

The web is advancing at an unprecedented rate, and you should be taking advantage of this. Learn what makes a progressive web app so progressive and some of the tooling you can use to build amazing (web) apps!

Vikram Tiwari: Cloud Run and AutoML Tables @Vikram_Tiwari

Serverless compute and ML on Google Cloud using Cloud Run and AutoML.

Building scalable web and data platforms for high availability, resilience, and security. Co-founder and all things tech at Omnilabsinc. GDE
at GoogleCloud and MachineLearning.

Riya Dashoriya: @ReeyahSDasoriya
"It's not that we use technology, we live technology" - Godfrey Reggio

I have a great zeal to learn about new technologies and share knowledge with people. I love coding. I like challenges at work or anything which can help me improve myself. I've veritable curiosity and passion to dig into things and find out how they work.

-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------

events.name: Intro to Machine Learning, TensorFlow 2, & Natural Language Processing

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
GDG Cloud Silicon Valley & GitAcademy present you a 3 hour crash course into Machine Learn, NLP, & TensorFlow 2.0

Hour #1: Intro to Machine Learning

What is Machine Learning (ML)?
Common Use Cases for ML
ML Terminology
Types of Learning in ML
Linear Regression
Classifiers in ML
Logistic Regression
Decision Trees/Random Forests
SVMs

Hour #2: What is NLP?

Main steps for NLP
Text normalization
Word vectors
Word embeddings
One-hot encoding
Term frequency
Stemming
Lemmatization
Stop words
What is tf-idf
What is NLTK
NLTK code samples
Other NLP toolkits
Useful NLP algorithms

Hour #3: Intro to TensorFlow 2

What is TensorFlow 2?
Major Changes in TF 2
Working with strings/arrays/tensors
Working with TF 2 @tf.function decorator
Working with TF 2 generators
Working with TF 2 tf.data.Dataset
Datasets in TF 1.x versus TF 2
Working with TF 2 tf.keras
CNNs, RNNs, LSTMs, Bidirectional LSTMs
Reinforcement Learning/TF Agents

Attendees who will derive the most benefit from this session have:
basic knowledge of Python is strongly recommended
a keen interest in Machine Learning
the ability to learn new concepts quickly

events.name: [Hands-On] Python for Data Science w/ Kaggle Exercise

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
**IMPORTANT INFORMATION

- The specific building location has not yet been confirmed, so please wait on the updated announcement for the exact place.

- Please bring your own food and drinks, as this particular event is not sponsored.

**EVENT DESCRIPTION

Learn python for Data science by actually writing code. Many people think programming is hard and they fail to learn. In fact, programming is easy but learning how to code is hard.

Let's change that. Bring your laptop and get hands-on with Amit for a fun-filled event.

No boring "hello world" type programming lectures and endless theories. You will actually do things and apply the stuff you learn. Yes, that is the difference.

What You'll Learn:

1st hour:

You will learn how to work with ordered data, structured data, functions, modules and much more and start writing code immediately.

2nd hour:

Introduction to NumPy

NumPy arrays – creation, methods, and attributes and how to Vectorize Operations with NumPy.

3rd hour:

We'll dive into Pandas, its capabilities, and its importance in the Python data science stack.

We will get real-life data from IBM Watson and use it to create a data frame.

You will be using Matplotlib for visualization. The goal is for you to be actually writing code using real-world data from IBM Watson and Kaggle.

4th hour:

You will be writing jaw-dropping code to create a data frame using data from Kaggle competition (https://www.kaggle.com/competitions.)

About the instructor:

Amit Sarkar -

"For the past 15 years, I worked literally as a hub of the software development process, making sure the right people are given the right information to do their jobs. As a program director, I was responsible for customers’ success on the AWS platform. This is largely a customer facing role with a strong technical angle, including both hands-on and higher-level architecture and thought leadership components. As a result, successfully developed many web application/ mobile app products that collectively created over $20 million revenue stream for the customers.

MY BACKGROUND: I have over 20 years of experience in Aerospace engineering, Cloud program management, Product development, Project management & Software development."

events.name: Deeplearning.ai | Pie & AI w/ Andrew Ng & Laurence Moroney @ Google

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Description

Welcome to our very first deeplearning.ai Pie & AI meetup in Silicon Valley! Meet your fellow deep learners and the deeplearning.ai team at Google!

To attend this event, please register at the below link:

http://bit.ly/2JLUWw5

Join us for a fireside chat with Andrew Ng and Laurence Moroney to celebrate the launch of the deeplearning.ai TensorFlow Specialization. Andrew and Laurence will discuss exciting AI trends, tips and tricks for TensorFlow, and how to build a career in AI. They'll also be taking questions from the audience.

We hope to see you for Pie & AI at Google!

Event Agenda:
6:00-6:30pm: Doors open

6:30-6:35pm: Introductions

6:35-7:05pm: Fireside chat with Andrew Ng & Laurence Moroney

7:05-7:30pm: Moderated Q&A

7:30-8:30pm: Drinks and pie!

Speaker:
Andrew Ng: Dr. Andrew Ng, a globally recognized leader in AI, is CEO of Landing AI and General Partner at AI Fund. As the former Chief Scientist at Baidu and the founding lead of Google Brain, he led the AI transformation of two of the world’s leading technology companies. A longtime advocate of accessible education, Dr. Ng is the Co-founder Coursera, an online learning platform, and founder of deeplearning.ai, an AI education platform. Dr. Ng is also an Adjunct Professor at Stanford University’s Computer Science Department.

Laurence Moroney: Laurence Moroney is an AI Advocate at Google working on helping developers succeed with Machine Learning and Deep Learning. He's the instructor for Coursera's TensorFlow specialization along with Andrew Ng, and is passionate about training the next generation of AI developers. He runs the TensorFlow channel on YouTube where he has several shows including 'Coding TensorFlow', 'TensorFlow Meets' and his favorite 'Coffee with a Googler'. When not Googling, he's the best selling author of both programming books and Science Fiction novels, a produced screenwriter, and author of the comic book prequel to the movie Equilibrium. Laurence lives in Washington State and drinks way too much coffee.

IMPORTANT NOTE:
You MUST be registered for this event on Eventbrite (http://bit.ly/2JLUWw5 ) to attend. We are not able to admit non-ticket holders into the building due to limited capacity. You will be required to sign in with a valid ID at the entrance.

SIGN UP HERE: http://bit.ly/2JLUWw5

Light snacks, drinks, and pie will be provided

Can't make it? The event will be recorded, and we'll post the link on deeplearning.ai social channels after the event.

events.name: Cloud Study Jam - [HANDS-ON  Machine Learning]

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
Join us for our upcoming Cloud Study Jam and get hands-on experience with Machine Learning.
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
You should be somewhat technical with Python and Command Shell! This workshop will also be limited to only 40-60 people in order to make it interactive with our instructor and the TAs.

In order to register for the event, YOU MUST sign up at this link: https://bit.ly/2YOz2mj
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
This is what we will be learning:
Tensorflow on GCP-Difficulty: Intermediate

*Machine Learning with TensorFlow
*TensorFlow for Poets
*Image Classification of Coastline Images Using TensorFlow on Cloud ML *Engine
*Predict Housing Prices with Tensorflow and Cloud ML Engine
*Creating an Object Detection Application Using TensorFlow
*The Path From Cloud AutoML to Custom Model:

[We will give the specific location of this event 3-5 days prior to the event. It will either be on the Sunnyvale or Moutain View Google Campus]
-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
MANDATORY:

At the event, we’ll use a tool called Qwiklabs, a Google training product. If you’ve used Qwiklabs before, great! Make sure you know your password. If you haven’t, save time by creating a new Qwiklabs account for yourself prior to the class at: https://google.qwiklabs.com/users/sign_up (creating an account is free).

We’ll give you a link and token for free Qwiklabs access. Make sure you check the opt-in box for promos, especially because that makes you eligible for additional free access after you complete the first series of labs.

You’ll Receive:

Free access to Qwiklabs hands-on labs, a $55+ value
Earn Google Cloud badges to show your skills and expertise
No need to register with a credit card

What to bring to the event:
Laptop -- Mac, PC, Chromebook, Linux, everyone’s welcome.
Laptop charger
The labs will run on all of the latest versions of the popular browsers. For the best experience, use Firefox or Chrome.
Looking forward to seeing you at the event!

[We will give the specific location of this event 3-5 days prior to the event. It will either be on the Sunnyvale or Moutain View Google Campus]

events.name: BIGGEST GDG Dev Fest of the YEAR!

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
ATTENDEES MUST PURCHASE TICKETS FROM => https://devfestsanfrancisco.eventbrite.com

NO TICKET, NO ENTRY!

GDG DevFest San Francisco returns on September 21st at the Google Launchpad and Galvanize. Join developers, students, mentors, and tech companies for the biggest community organized Google developer conference in San Francisco. DevFest San Francisco is a community-run, one-day conference aimed at bringing technology enthusiasts and experts together. About 300 people are estimated to attend DevFest, with speakers coming from all over Bay Area and the US. The talks will focus on Google technologies along with other emerging technologies such as Android, Flutter, Firebase, Google Cloud Platform, the Mobile Web, Google Assistant, Machine Learning, and more.

DevFest attendees will be able to familiarize themselves with new and emerging technologies, network, socialize, and help to build the growing tech community in San Francisco and the Bay Area. Anyone interested in technology is welcome. Each ticket includes talks from industry experts, skill-building sessions, gifts, and lunch.

Stay tuned for our schedule...

Submit your talk here: https://www.papercall.io/gdgdevfest

Brought to you, with love, by GDG San Francisco, GDG Cloud San Francisco, GDG Fremont, GDG Cloud Fremont and GDG Cloud Silicon Valley!

events.name: Alphabet X's TensorNetwork Intro & Developer Sprint (Nov 6-7)

group.name: Google Developer Group Cloud (GDG) - Silicon Valley

events.description:
X, The Moonshot Factory (formerly Google X) will be hosting a session for 100+ developers, students, professionals and academics looking to get up to speed with tensor networks, a powerful data structure for dealing with quantum systems and applications in machine learning.

This will take place during the Rebooting Computing conference in San Mateo. Delicious (complementary) dinner will be served, along with some cool SWAG :).
To attend this event you have to RSVP at the following link
http://bit.ly/2JwYByK
